Following ankle surgery, Shami delivered a fiery spell, taking eight wickets to lead Bengal to victory. He expressed his commitment to staying fit and performing, leaving the decision to selectors.

title: Yuvraj Singh reveals he suggested ‘divorce’ to his parents amid constant fights
description: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh revealed he urged his parents to separate at age 14-15 due to constant fighting, which he felt was detrimental to the family. He expressed deep gratitude for his mother's sacrifices in raising him after the divorce. Yuvraj's relationship with his father, actor Yograj Singh, has remained strained over the years.

title: BJP neta arrested for crushing farmer to death, harassing his family
description: BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar has been arrested as the main accused in the murder of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad. Dhakad was attacked by armed men and run over by a vehicle following a land dispute. Nagar is also accused of molesting the victim's daughter during the incident.

title: North Korea touts missile tests as Trump visits South Korea
Morning Digest: Severe Cyclonic Storm Montha crosses A.P. coast, weakens into Cyclonic Storm; Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel, Hamas exchange fire, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: U.S. kills 14 in strikes on alleged Pacific drug boats
description: In three strikes carried out Monday (October 27, 2025) in international waters, 14 “narco-terrorists” were killed and one survived, U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said, making it the deadliest day of the U.S. campaign so far

title: 'It's time to move forward' - PSL team owner calls for truce with PCB
description: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has extended an olive branch to the PCB, proposing four reforms for better PSL management after a public dispute. Tareen, who previously tore up a legal notice from the board, now seeks a "fresh relationship" built on transparency and trust. This move follows a heated exchange over critical remarks about PSL governance.

title: Smoke over Rio de Janeiro: Anti-gang raid leaves 64 dead, including four cops — video
description: A massive police operation targeting the Comando Vermelho gang in Rio de Janeiro resulted in at least 64 deaths, including four officers, marking the deadliest raid in the city's history. The operation, involving 2,500 security personnel, occurred days before Rio hosts major global climate events.

description: Senior Indian cricketers like Mohammed Shami, Ajinkya Rahane, and Karun Nair are publicly expressing frustration over selection policies and communication gaps under Ajit Agarkar's committee. Concerns about transparency and age bias have surfaced, with players questioning their exclusion despite strong domestic performances. This highlights a growing disconnect between experienced players and the selection panel's approach.

North Korea fires cruise missiles ahead of Donald Trump-Xi Jinping meeting in South Korea
description: North Korea launched sea-to-surface cruise missiles into western waters, a move that could bolster its nuclear-armed military. This occurred just before US President Trump's arrival in South Korea for talks. Pyongyang has shunned negotiations with Washington and Seoul since 2019, with leader Kim Jong Un now prioritizing Russia and opposing denuclearization demands.

Memories of the mid-1960s rice shortage in Tamil Nadu
description: The Hindu, in a news report on October 7, 1964, stated: “Thanjavur district, the ‘rice bowl’ of the Madras State [which was how the State was called then], has been experiencing very great difficulty for the last six weeks in meeting the local demands for rice and daily one can see long queues in every town and village in the district waiting for hours to get their daily quota.”

title: Shreyas Iyer update: Near-fatal injury to ICU exit — how the Sydney scare unfolded
description: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is stable after a serious on-field injury in Sydney, which caused internal bleeding and required ICU care. Doctors successfully arrested the bleeding through a medical procedure, and Iyer is now recovering well, out of the ICU, and eating normally. His recovery is progressing faster than anticipated.

description: Within the minutes, flames consumed at least 49 people including women and children. It took two hours for eight fire tenders, from Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur and Madras to put out the blaze.

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra, Odisha battered; 1 dead, thousands evacuated
description: Cyclone Montha made landfall on India's eastern coast, bringing fierce winds and heavy rain to Andhra Pradesh and Odisha. The severe storm caused damage, including snapped power lines and flooded homes, with one fatality reported in Andhra Pradesh. Authorities initiated extensive evacuations and deployed rescue teams to aid affected populations.

title: Cognitive confusion: Trump refers to dementia screening as 'very hard' IQ test
description: President Trump claimed to have aced a "very hard" IQ test at Walter Reed, challenging political opponents. However, experts confirm the exam was the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), a tool for detecting early cognitive decline, not an intelligence test. This misrepresentation raises concerns about health communication and political messaging.

‘Tough timing’: GM axes 200 salaried staff; layoffs hit days after profit surge
description: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.
